docs.lead_paragraph: Trot Nixon, once the epitome of Boston Red Sox grit and determination, is toiling for the Tucson Sidewinders and hoping at age 34 for another shot at the big leagues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bartolo Colón is competing for the vacancy in the rotation created by Curt Schilling’s shoulder injury, which is expected to sideline him for at least half the season.

docs.lead_paragraph: After managing the Boston Red Sox to two World Series titles in four seasons, Terry Francona was rewarded Sunday with a three-year contract extension that runs through 2011.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leo Nunez took a shutout into the fifth inning in his first career start, outpitching the 15-year veteran Tim Wakefield last night to help the visiting Kansas City Royals defeat the Boston Red Sox, 9-3.

docs.lead_paragraph: Curt Schilling, who is 6-4 and nearly pitched a no-hitter against Oakland on June 7, will be placed on the 15-day disabled list Friday with what the club is calling a sore right shoulder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Outfielder J.D. Drew doesn’t have a contract with the Red Sox. The club and Drew’s agent, Scott Boras, have taken longer to complete a contract than they took negotiating its terms.
